intro: Monticalia viridialba, commonly known as the green-leafed monticalia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. Monticalia viridialba is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
